messages.content: As an AI assistant, my role is to meticulously analyze criminal justice documents and extract information about law enforcement personnel. The response will contain: 1) The name of a law enforcement personnel. The individual's name must be prefixed with one of the following titles to be in law enforcement: Detective, Sergeant, Lieutenant, Captain, Deputy, Officer, Patrol Officer, Criminalist, Technician, Coroner, or Dr. Please prefix the name with 'Officer Name:  I will derive this data from the following paragraph: On January 17, DET. W. X. Grayson was called to investigate a series of thefts in the Lakeside Community Center. Key informants were Mr. Turner, a community member, and Ms. Bennett, the center's director. FORWARD COPY TO: DETECTIVE DIVISION. INFORMANT DOCS. Lt. Y. Z. Webb - OPERATIONS Det. Grayson, Sr. .. INVESTIGATIONS. Detective A. B. Romero and Detective C. D. Foster joined to review the scene. MASON 07:55 Theft Mr. Turner discovered missing sports equipment, and Ms. Bennett provided access logs to the storage rooms. Lock. Technician Nina examined the tampered storage room locks. CONTINUED FORWARD TO: DETECTIVE DIVISION 3- STATUS [CHECK ONE] Det. Grayson Sr, Det. Romero, Det. Foster OPERATIONS Lt. Webb INFORMANT Bennett, Diana 52 Pine Street, Lakeside, Oregon 159-600. 92885. MASON 07:55 Theft By 9:15 AM, Detectives Grayson, Romero, and Foster, with Lieutenant Webb's oversight, pinpointed potential theft timings from the logs. Captain E. F. Shaw directed a community-wide inquiry. Sergeant G. H. Owens and Sergeant I. J. Stone spearheaded neighborhood interviews. By 10:50 AM, two teenagers were identified and questioned. FORWARD TO: DETECTIVE DIVISION 3- STATUS [CHECK ONE] Det. Grayson Sr, Det. Romero, Det. Foster OPERATIONS Lt. Webb AFFIDAVIT - Theft Report 1) Storage Room Access Logs 2) Witness Statements 3) F.I.R. 4) List of Missing Items 5) Community CCTV (6) Other Details LINE UP INFO ASSISTANT CHIEF DEPUTY IN CHARGE K. Riley L.C.P.D. 18.30 P46 2075 Turner, LEO NAME: ADDRESS: TELEPHONE: 120-2377 DETECTIVE: W. GRAYSON ITEM: 46-4850- 95 CRIME: 07:55 IDENTIFICATION NUMBER 82480 - CONFIRMED Jane Doe DATE 7/05/23 FORWARD TO: DETECTIVE DIVISION CONTINUED.
Identify each individual in the transcript, by name, who are directly referred to as officers, sergeants, lieutenants, captains, detectives, homicide officers, and crime lab personnel.

Officer Name: DET. W. X. Grayson  Officer Context: On January 17, DET. W. X. Grayson was called to investigate a series of thefts in the Lakeside Community Center. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Lt. Y. Z. Webb  Officer Context: Lt. Y. Z. Webb - OPERATIONS Officer Role: Lieutenant Officer Name: Detective A. B. Romero  Officer Context: Detective A. B. Romero and Detective C. D. Foster joined to review the scene. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Detective C. D. Foster  Officer Context: Detective A. B. Romero and Detective C. D. Foster joined to review the scene. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Technician Nina  Officer Context: Lock. Technician Nina examined the tampered storage room locks. Officer Role: Technician Officer Name: Detective Grayson  Officer Context: By 9:15 AM, Detectives Grayson, Romero, and Foster, with Lieutenant Webb's oversight, pinpointed potential theft timings from the logs. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Detective Romero  Officer Context: By 9:15 AM, Detectives Grayson, Romero, and Foster, with Lieutenant Webb's oversight, pinpointed potential theft timings from the logs. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Detective Foster  Officer Context: By 9:15 AM, Detectives Grayson, Romero, and Foster, with Lieutenant Webb's oversight, pinpointed potential theft timings from the logs. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Captain E. F. Shaw  Officer Context: Captain E. F. Shaw directed a community-wide inquiry. Officer Role: Captain Officer Name: Sergeant G. H. Owens  Officer Context: Sergeant G. H. Owens and Sergeant I. J. Stone spearheaded neighborhood interviews. Officer Role: Sergeant Officer Name: Sergeant I. J. Stone Officer Context: Sergeant G. H. Owens and Sergeant I. J. Stone spearheaded neighborhood interviews. Officer Role: Sergeant
